summary: This document is an email chain from October 15, 2020, in which a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York contacts the Palm Beach County Clerk's office. The prosecutor, handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell, requests access to grand jury materials from the state-level Epstein prosecution in Palm Beach County, seeking guidance on the proper procedure to obtain transcripts and records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of federal investigation, previously prosecuted in state court
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing federal investigation for which the prosecutor is seeking related grand jury materials from a prior state prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing federal prosecution for which the prosecutor is seeking related grand jury materials.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Colleague of the emailing prosecutor, copied on the request for grand jury materials related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Chief Communications Officer
persons.role: Communications officer for the Palm Beach County Clerk's office
persons.context: Responds to the federal prosecutor's inquiry, stating they are not the correct contact and forwarding the request to the Chief Operating Officer for Courts and Legal Records and the Acting General Counsel.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same ongoing federal investigation and prosecution, indicating their alleged involvement in related criminal activity.
The federal prosecutor (AUSA) is part of the team handling the investigation regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The federal prosecutor (AUSA) is part of the team handling the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Federal Request for State Grand Jury Materials
events.description: A federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York emails the Palm Beach County Clerk's office to request transcripts and records from the state grand jury that heard evidence in the Jeffrey Epstein case, as part of the ongoing federal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: 301 N. Olive Ave., 9th Floor, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell as of October 2020.
The federal investigation sought evidence, including witness testimony, that had been presented to a state grand jury in Palm Beach County during the earlier prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.
The email reveals procedural coordination between federal and state jurisdictions, with the prosecutor inquiring if a federal unsealing order would suffice to obtain the state grand jury materials.
The communication highlights the ongoing nature of the federal investigation into Epstein/Maxwell networks years after Epstein's initial state prosecution.
